sub_topic: Determining the VSEPR geometry of a molecule
message_1: What is the VSEPR geometry of a molecule with four bonded atoms and one lone pair of electrons on the central atom?
message_2: The VSEPR geometry of a molecule with four bonded atoms and one lone pair of electrons on the central atom is called "See-saw" or "Distorted tetrahedral" geometry. This is because the presence of the lone pair pushes the bonded atoms away, causing a distortion in the tetrahedral arrangement.
